alert.note: Alert for Kemper; Lauderdale; Neshoba (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 11:24PM CDT until June 15 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT FOR LEAKE...NEWTON...SOUTHERN KEMPER...NORTHERN SCOTT...SOUTHERN NESHOBA AND LAUDERDALE COUNTIES... At 1123 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Stratton, or near Decatur, moving east at 50 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR Decatur and surrounding areas. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. This severe storm will be near... Little Rock around 1135 PM CDT. Collinsville and Duffee around 1140 PM CDT. Martin around 1145 PM CDT. Meridian, Nellieburg and Suqualena around 1150 PM CDT. Marion around 1200 AM CDT. Toomsuba around 1210 AM CDT. Alamucha and Kewanee around 1215 AM CDT. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
